criteria: Ability to represent constraints using equations or inequalities.
Ability to represent constraints using systems of equations and/or inequalities.
Ability to interpret solutions as viable or non-viable options in a modeling context.
descriptions: Student demonstrates no understanding of how to represent constraints using equations or inequalities.
Student can represent simple constraints using equations or inequalities with significant errors.
Student can represent basic constraints using equations or inequalities with some errors.
Student can represent most constraints using equations or inequalities with minor errors.
Student can accurately represent constraints using equations or inequalities in most contexts.
Student can accurately and effectively represent constraints using equations or inequalities in all contexts.
Student demonstrates no understanding of how to represent constraints using systems of equations and/or inequalities.
Student attempts to represent constraints using systems of equations/inequalities but with major flaws and misunderstandings.
Student can represent simple constraints using systems of equations/inequalities with some errors.
Student can represent most constraints using systems of equations/inequalities with minor errors.
Student can accurately represent constraints using systems of equations/inequalities in most contexts.
Student can accurately and effectively represent constraints using systems of equations/inequalities in various complex contexts.
Student cannot interpret solutions in a modeling context and does not identify viable or non-viable options.
Student attempts to interpret solutions but shows significant misunderstanding of viability in a modeling context.
Student can identify some viable or non-viable options with significant prompting.
Student can interpret solutions and identify viable or non-viable options in simple modeling contexts.
Student can interpret solutions and identify viable or non-viable options in most modeling contexts with minimal guidance.
Student can effectively interpret solutions and justify viable or non-viable options in complex modeling contexts with clear explanations.
